com.vijfhart.casus.tree

Class NodeTree<T extends Node<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vijfhart.casus.tree.NodeTree<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Tree<T>, TreeIterable<T>, java.lang.Iterable<T>

    public class NodeTree<T extends Node<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Tree<T>
    NodeTree is an implementation of Tree. It uses an anonymous inner class to implement a TreeIterator. The descendantsOf method is used to generate a list of descendants of a node. This method is also used to calculate summary measures of a node.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NodeTree()
      empty constructor
      NodeTree(java.util.List<T> list)
      This constructor can be used to generate a copy of a NodeTree.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(T t)
        Adds a node to the tree. NodeTree uses a List for its elements. The add method is delegated to this list.
        Specified by:
        add in interface Tree<T extends Node<T>>
        Parameters:
        t: - the node to add to the tree

      • descendantsOf

        public java.util.List<T> descendantsOf(T node)
        Generates a list of nodes descending a given node, including the given node itself. It uses the startWith method to generate a sublist of the node itself and its descendants.
        Specified by:
        descendantsOf in interface Tree<T extends Node<T>>
        Parameters:
        node: - a node
        Returns:
        a list of nodes descending and including the given node.

      • descendantCount

        public long descendantCount(T t)
        A count of the nodes descending a given node. It uses descendantsOf to get the list of nodes.
        Specified by:
        descendantCount in interface Tree<T extends Node<T>>
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the count of nodes descending the given node, excluding the given node.

      • iterator

        public TreeIterator<T> iterator()
        Returns a TreeIterator to loop through the node elements in a Tree. The TreeIterator uses the iterator of the nodeList of de NodeTree. With every loop information is saved about the current node and the ancestors of the current node.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface TreeIterable<T extends Node<T>>
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<T extends Node<T>>
        Returns:
        a TreeIterator
